intro: Anuragia pentagona, commonly known as the five-angled milkweed, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive pentagonal-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its milky sap contains toxic compounds, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. Anuragia pentagona is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
